page.title: 20BUCKLAND VILLAGE DARTMOOR
page.content: Buckland-in-the-Moor was Bochelanda in the {Domesday Book.}We were told that the village is not as tidy as it used to be as residents get into their cars and go off for the day We walked between dry stone walls bright with foxgloves,woodvetch,cow parsley and dandelions,onto the moor, where heather was blooming and sheep and wild Dartmoor ponies grazing,and climbed to Buckland Beacon where the Ten Commandments were carved to celebrate Parliament's rejection of the new Prayer Book in 1924.To the West we looked down on{Buckland-in-the {Moor.}To the East we looked down to the coast and could see the tower and the spire of the churches of St.Mary church.We knew that Cuthbert Mayne Comprehensive,our school,was just below them. We had driven the 14 miles from Torquay often to do this survey.
